channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Curaçao to Cape Verde: Small nations make big World Cup history
item.description: From tiny Curaçao, to troubled Haiti's remarkable comeback, discover how some of the smallest nations in the world are defying the odds to qualify for...

item.title: How Kash Patel is roiling the FBI and changing its mission
item.description: New York er writer Marc Fisher says Patel became FBI director without senior law enforcement experience because of his loyalty to Trump and willingnes...

item.title: A fire in southwestern Japan damages 170 homes and forces evacuations
item.description: Firefighters and army helicopters battled a fire that burned through old wooden houses in a fishing town in southwestern Japan.

item.title: Greetings from Yimianpo, China, where artisans carve Russian nesting dolls
item.description: Far-Flung Postcards is a weekly series in which NPR's international team shares moments from their lives and work around the world.

item.title: As a labor force, artists are 'invisible.' A new survey tries to change that
item.description: 'Struggling artists' isn't a trope, according to a new report. The survey asked more than 2,600 artists about everything from hours worked to housing.

item.title: 11/18: The Takeout with Major Garrett
item.description: House overwhelmingly passes bill to release Epstein files with lone "no" vote; Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman visits U.S. for the first time s...

item.title: Speculation intensifies in the death of a Florida high schooler on a cruise
What happens to California's redistricting after Texas' maps were struck down?
item.description: The court ruling came after California voters formally approved a ballot measure that was introduced to counteract Texas' redistricting.

item.title: Israeli strikes across Gaza kill 25 Palestinians, health ministry says
item.description: The Israeli military says it struck several Hamas targets after gunmen fired at soldiers in Gaza in violation of the five-week-old ceasefire.

item.title: Will life insurance be worth it for seniors in 2026?
item.description: The right life insurance policy (at the right price) could be valuable for seniors in 2026. Here's why.

item.title: FBI veteran alleges he was fired for displaying Pride flag
item.description: A 16-year FBI employee has filed a lawsuit alleging he was fired last month because he had a Pride flag displayed near his desk.

item.title: Instagram owner Meta tells Australian teens accounts will close
item.description: Under-sixteens will be banned from major social media plaforms from 10 December.

item.title: Dozens go on trial over North Macedonia nightclub fire that killed 63
item.description: Thirty-five people and three institutions are on trial. Prosecutors say years of failings turned the venue into a death trap.

item.title: All 267 passengers and crew rescued after South Korean ferry runs aground
item.description: The vessel remains stuck on a reef and unable to move, but there is no risk of sinking, the Coast Guard said.

item.title: 5 charts that illustrate America's deepening affordability crisis
item.description: Although inflation has eased, many Americans say they still feel squeezed financially. Here are five areas where households are feeling the pinch.

item.title: Man accused of setting a woman on fire on a Chicago train is charged with terrorism

item.description: The vessel remains stuck on a reef and unable to move, but there is no risk of sinking, the Coast Guard said.

item.title: Arrests now top 250 in immigration crackdown across North Carolina
item.description: Federal agents have now arrested more than 250 people during an immigration crackdown in North Carolina centered around Charlotte, the state’s largest...
